item.description:
Spend a weekend in the beautiful Berkshire Mountain region!

This beautiful, modern cottage sits on 360 acres of field and forest with 34 miles of trails at our door!

We can hike, bike, snow shoe, xc-ski or just relax. The cottage was recently renovated and has a very modern kitchen, and four bedrooms with 9 beds. (Private room may be available for a couple.)

LIMIT: 9 people!

Activities include: Hiking on 34 miles of trails, Biking, Snow Shoeing, XC Skiing, Swimming, Bird Watching, Nature Study. Many miles of trails bring you to forested gorges, quiet streams, and rocky outcrops with stunning views. There are quiet country lanes to bike on, and the entire Berkshire region is close by to explore.

Reserve online, or email & send a check to: Larry Pilla, 21 Baker St. Dover, NH 03820.

Two nights' lodging is included: Friday & Saturday night.

The Cottage is heated with a wood stove and has electricity, a large refrigerator, and a 6-burner gas range.  Firewood is provided. Beds have five-inch-thick mattresses. It can accommodate 10 people in four bedrooms. Sleeping is in shared rooms, 2-3 per room.

The main floor has a large kitchen with a dining room, and a living room with couches, tables and chairs, recessed lighting, and ceiling fan. The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans, silverware, glasses, cups, plates and bowls.

More importantly, this place has dozens of miles of beautiful trails. There will be waterfalls, wildflowers, colorful birds, babbling brooks, and amazing views!

And if there's snow, bring your snowshoes and xc skis!

Hot showers!

Yes, HOT SHOWERS this time and toilets are housed in the newly-completed Bath House, about 100 feet from the cottage. It offers drinking water, hot showers, sinks, flush toilets, dishwashing stations, and the latest in green technology, including solar electric and solar heat.

Bring: Towels, headlamp, bedding, blankets or a sleeping bag. Food! Wine! Beer!

Meals: This will be a fun, group trip! As we've done in the past, we'll prepare and eat our meals together. Everyone will pitch in to prepare and clean up. And if you can't cook, don't worry. You can bring the olive tapenade, goat cheese, and wine!

Carpool: We'll arrange rides once we see who's coming. Drive Time: Portsmouth - 2.5hrs;  Newburyport - 2.25hrs.

Liability Release: AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.


 Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
